abstract: Seattle Police Dept, operating under federal independent monitor since 2012, is focused on improving relationship with public by developing strategies helpful not only in dealing with major crimes, but issues like stolen property; changes paid off for Seattle resident Anthony Posey, professional photographer who had camera stolen that held thousands of images shot for client; detective searching for camera connected enough information from web- and social media-based tools to find and return camera to Posey with photos intact.
lead_paragraph: When a vacationer’s camera was stolen in Seattle’s library, he wrote it off as lost forever. But the police weren’t ready to give up without trying some new tools at their disposal.

headline.main: How Seattle Police and Social Media Solved Mystery of Stolen Camera
headline.print_headline: Police. A Camera. And Smiles All Around.

snippet: When a vacationer’s camera was stolen in Seattle’s library, he wrote it off as lost forever. But the police weren’t ready to give up without trying some new tools at their disposal.
